intro: Pimpinella gouanii, commonly known as the African cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Pimpinella gouanii is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
